candidates.before_politics: MD as well as NGO Chairman
candidates.name: Richard Stein
candidates.why_elect: I will bring years of governance experience to the Board. Among other roles, I was Chief of Staff and a board member of a major U.S. medical centre. As current Chairman of Crohn's and Colitis NZ, I have regular dealings with the Health Ministry, Pharmac, and other policy makers.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we need a doctor on the Board. We need someone who has worked within the system and knows first-hand its strengths and weaknesses. Provider and patient concerns are not being addressed. I want to give these concerns a voice.

candidates.name: Kamiria Mid Thomas-Savelio
candidates.why_elect: I have been in business for myself and managed other organisations for over 20 years. Align this to an MBA from Victoria University and a strong appetite for governance and I believe I have the skill set required to be a fully functioning member of the DHB.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for the DHB because I have a deep passion for health and wellbeing. As a person who has been on the frontline of health for over 25 years I would love the opportunity to help the community with which I live in.

candidates.name: Josh Briggs
candidates.why_elect: I have a strong background in health. I worked as part of a primary health care multidisciplinary team. I have achieved widespread governance experience on national and local boards, including in my previous role as Chairperson of Vibe and my current role as a Hutt City Councillor.
candidates.why_stand: I want more effective healthcare for our community. I'm passionate about healthcare equality, mental health support in our communities, a thriving primary care system and valuing our healthcare workforce. I understand the factors that contribute towards health and wellbeing and I want to advocate for my community.

candidates.name: Keri Brown
candidates.why_elect: The Hutt is my home. I've got the right mix of experience. I've worked in government in advisory roles, in the community where I rolled my sleeves up and worked on policy. I've seen the need for better health services and I know I can be that strong voice.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our community deserves a top quality, equal health service and at the moment, we don't have that. I lost close family to cancer and saw first-hand the lack of consistent health services. I don't want other families feeling confused about what is happening to their loved ones.

candidates.name: Cheryl Davies
candidates.why_elect: I bring extensive knowledge and I understand the need to address health inequities for Māori and communities in need. I have 20 years experience working on a number of research studies that have given voice to our communities to talk about the health and aspirations they have for their whānau.
candidates.why_stand: I have lived in Wainuiomata for most of my life and I am passionate about the Hutt Valley community. I have had the privilege of providing health services to whānau/families in the Hut Valley over the past 30 years.

candidates.name: Wayne Guppy
candidates.why_elect: I am a former pharmacist so I understand the health system and have good governance experience as the Mayor of Upper Hutt, Deputy Chair of the District HB and Chair of the Hutt Valley Finance and Audit Committee (FRAC) and Co-chair of the CCHB/HVDHB FRAC.
candidates.why_stand: As Deputy Chair of the HVDHB I see the approach that is being taken now with close calibration with Capital Coast very exciting as we deliver a world class health service to the people of the region, in particular the Hutt Valley.

candidates.name: David Ogden
candidates.why_elect: I have lived a professional life in finance and chartered accountancy, and have served as a corporate treasurer, and financial controller. As well I have served as an elected person to make sure that the board or body I serve on is one of the best in New Zealand.
candidates.why_stand: I have to come to love the work that we do on the health board, due to people involved, the importance of it in our community and region. I wish to continue to devote myself to serving on this board.
